description: Manages a V2 Load Balancer resource within Enterprise Cloud.

IpAddress.description:
The physical IP address associated with the interface.
The IP address must be in the network specified as the argument `network_id`.

Name.description: The name of the Load Balancer Interface.

NetworkId.description: The UUID of the network associated with the interface.

VirtualIpAddress.description:
The virtual IP address associated with the interface. The IP address must be in
the network specified as the argument `network_id`.

AclLogging.description:
Should syslog record acl info. Must be
one of "ENABLED" and "DISABLED".

AppflowLogging.description:
Should syslog record appflow info. Must be
one of "ENABLED" and "DISABLED".

DateFormat.description:
Date format utilized by syslog. Must be
one of "DDMMYYYY", "MMDDYYYY" and "YYYYMMDD".

IpAddress.description:
IP address of syslog server. The syslog server
IP address must be in the network connected to the Load Balancer Interface
defined as the argument `interfaces`. Changing this creates a new syslog server.

LogFacility.description:
Log facility for syslog. Must be
one of "LOCAL0", "LOCAL1", "LOCAL2", "LOCAL3", "LOCAL4", "LOCAL5",
"LOCAL6" and "LOCAL7".

LogLevel.description:
Valid elements for log_level are
"ALERT", "CRITICAL", "EMERGENCY", "INFORMATIONAL", "NOTICE",
"ALL", "DEBUG", "ERROR", "NONE", "WARNING". `log_level` value can be assigned
combining multiple elements as "ALERT|CRITICAL|EMERGENCY".
Caution: Can not combine "ALL" or "NONE" with the others.

Name.description:
The name of the Load Balancer Syslog Server.
Changing this creates a new syslog server.

PortNumber.description:
The port number of syslog server.
This value is integer, no less than 1 and no more than 65535.
Changing this creates a new syslog server.

Priority.description:
The priority of syslog server.
This value is integer, no less than 0 and no more than 255.

TcpLogging.description:
Should syslog record tcp protocol info. Must be
one of "NONE" and "ALL".

TenantId.description:
The owner of the syslog server. Required
if admin wants to create a syslog server for another tenant.
Changing this creates a new syslog server.

TimeZone.description:
Time zone utilized by syslog. Must be
one of "GMT_TIME" and "LOCAL_TIME".

TransportType.description:
Protocol for syslog transport. Must be
"UDP".

UserConfigurableLogMessages.description:
Can user configure log messages.
Must be one of "YES" and "NO".

Vrid.description:
VRRP group identifier. This value is integer,
no less than 1 and no more than 255.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AvailabilityZone.description:
The availability zone in which to create
the Load Balancer. Changing this creates a new Load Balancer.

DefaultGateway.description:
IP address of default gateway. The default gateway
IP address must be in the network connected to the Load Balancer Interface
defined as the argument `interfaces`.

LoadBalancerPlanId.description:
The UUID of Load Balancer Plan uses
by the Load Balancer.

Name.description: The name of the Load Balancer.

TenantId.description:
The owner of the Load Balancer. Required
if admin wants to create a Load Balancer for another tenant.
Changing this creates a new Load Balancer.
